definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: Abaxial surface of calyx with needle-like prickles.
sentences.chinese: 背面花萼具針葉象一樣皮刺。
苞片和花萼星狀氈毛狀。

sentences.english: The former are considered to be homologous with the sepals of Ranunculus.
sentences.chinese: 普通認爲，前者的花瓣與毛茛屬植物花萼同源。

sentences.english: Calyx campanulate; lobes 5, subequal , as long as tube.
sentences.chinese: 花萼鍾狀裂片5，近等長，倍於筒部。

sentences.english: Qualitative study on the structure of roselle calyx red pigment;
sentences.chinese: 對玫瑰茄花萼化學成分和藥理作用進行了綜述。

sentences.english: With buds and pink in mountains here;
sentences.chinese: 在這山中長出粉紅的花萼。

sentences.english: Rachises , bracts, pedicels, and calyces glandular pilose.
sentences.chinese: 軸，苞，花梗和花萼具腺柔毛。

sentences.english: The type genus of the family brome liaceae which incudes tropical american plants with deeply cleft calyx.
sentences.chinese: 鳳梨科的模式屬，包括有深裂花萼的熱帶美洲植物。

sentences.english: That's why the term "flower and calyx" has come to be used to refer to brotherly affection.
sentences.chinese: 所以後來的人，就用“花萼”來比喻兄弟的友愛。

sentences.english: The sepal is usually green. It can protect the flower bud.
sentences.chinese: 花萼通常是綠色的，它能保護花芽。

sentences.english: The fleshy red calyxes of roselle are edible.
sentences.chinese: 洛神葵的肉質花萼可食。

sentences.english: Leptothrium , while the indumentum of calyx margins is various and can not be used to distinguish the species.
sentences.chinese: 而花萼邊緣的毛被變異大，不能用於組內分種。

sentences.english: The floral nectary in Litchi chinensis is a disc nectary located between calyx and ovary on receptacle.
sentences.chinese: 荔枝花蜜腺呈盤狀，位於子房和花萼之間的花托上。

sentences.english: Calyx of the bright pink pigment, the coloring agent in food.
sentences.chinese: 花萼的明亮的粉紅色顏料，食品着色劑。

sentences.english: Calyx encloses an unopened flower bud.
sentences.chinese: 花萼圍繞在花瓣的外層。

sentences.english: The bell of a flower is very beautiful.

definition: perianth (common term for calyx and corolla)/border and protecting envelope of a flower
